intro: Evodianthus funifer subsp. trailianus, commonly known as the Trailian's spider orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, which includes intricate, spider-like petals and a distinctive, elongated lip. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in cloud forests or mountainous regions with high biodiversity. Its flowers are pollinated by specific insect species, highlighting its ecological niche and dependence on particular pollinators. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in conservation efforts.
